alert.note: Alert for Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 10:08PM EDT until May 08 at 7:47AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in West Virginia... Buckhannon River Near Buckhannon affecting Upshur County. For the Tygart Valley River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buckhannon River Near Buckhannon. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Several streets, homes, and businesses along the river flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Saturday was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 20.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 02/07/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 800 AM EDT.
